title: Unitary is not federal, devolution can be revoked

content.question: A unitary system that has experienced devolution is different from a federal system because

choices.label: in a unitary system, subunits of government are not accountable to citizens
in a unitary system, subunits of government have more authority
in a unitary system, devolution can be revoked by the central legislature
a unitary system has more political legitimacy
only a unitary system experiences redistribution of resources among units of government

content.answer: in a unitary system, devolution can be revoked by the central legislature

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Compare political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
